app.terms.title: AKASHA: Условия использования
app.terms.preface:
1 AKASHA - это социальная блоговая сеть нового поколения, основанная на новом компьютере, известном как Ethereum и Inter Planetary File System. Будучи полностью децентрализованной платформой, AKASHA не контролируется Любое юридическое лицо или частное лицо. В то время как AKASHA International GmbH разработала и будет продолжать развивать AKASHA, она не будет управлять или управлять AKASHA и / или контентом, доступным для пользователей через AKASHA. -interface akasha.world, который может быть использован для доступа к AKASHA.

2 Используя AKASHA и создавая AKASHA Identity или Profile Smart Contract, вы подтверждаете, что внимательно изучили и полностью поняли и согласились («Условия»).

3 Поскольку текущая версия AKASHA - это только предварительная альфа-версия, мы можем попросить вас ознакомиться с ней и ознакомиться с ней Новые или дополнительные условия, которые применяются к вашему взаимодействию с AKASHA и новыми функциональными возможностями в будущем.

4 Перед установкой AKAHSA убедитесь, что вы загрузили ZIP-файл, Alpha приглашает напрямую отправленный AKASHA. Распаковка / установка любых других файлов может привести к существенным рискам безопасности.
app.terms.privacyBody: Ваша конфиденциальность очень важна для нас, что отличает AKASHA от других социальных сетей. Мы разработали программу AKASHA таким образом, чтобы вы сохраняли контроль над своими данными и тем, как вы делитесь ими с другими. AKASHA не будет собирать и использовать ваш контент и информацию для любых других целей, кроме избранных вами.
app.terms.sharingYourContentBody:
6 AKASHA does not claim ownership in any of the content and information you post on AKASHA. AKASHA allows you to control your content and how it is shared through your AKASHA settings.

7 For content that is covered by intellectual property rights, like photos, text and videos (IP Content), you have the possibility to choose between different Licence Options (covering a spectrum from all rights reserved to no rights reserved) allowing you the specify how and under what conditions your content may be distributed and used by others.

8 By publishing your IP Content on AKASHA, you grant AKASHA non-exclusive, transferable, sub-licensable, royalty-free, worldwide license to use the IP content for the purpose of its publication and distribution on AKASHA and subject to the conditions specified by you in the Licence Options.

9 You are aware that AKASHA is a decentralized application and that, consequently, content published on AKASHA is not under control of any legal entity or private individual. Accordingly, you may not fully delete any content published from the AKASHA Platform. When you remove content, your content is only delisted which makes it more difficult to be found for others. However, you understand that removed content persist without any time limitation and may still be available to others.

10 When you publish content using the setting “No rights reserved” in the License Option, it means that you are allowing everyone to access and use that content, to associate it with you (i.e., your name and profile picture) and that you wave all your rights, including copyrights and related rights, to this content.
app.terms.noUnlawfulBody:
11 You are aware that AKASHA is a fully decentralized platform that is not under control of any legal entity or private individual. AKASHA and/or AKASHA International GmbH has no knowledge of and no means to control whether any content published on AKASHA violates any third party intellectual property rights or is illegal under the laws of certain jurisdictions. Accordingly, the success of AKASHA relies in the responsibility of each User. By using AKASHA you commit to keep AKASHA clean from any unlawful content and activities. In particular:

  • You will not solicit login information or access a Profile belonging to someone else.
  • You will not bully, intimidate or harass any other User.
  • You will not post content that is hate speech, threatening, incites violence.
  • You will not use AKASHA to do anything unlawful in your jurisdiction or in Switzerland.
  • You will not use AKASHA to do anything misleading, malicious or discriminatory.
  • You will not post content or take any action on AKASHA that infringes or violates someone else's rights, including copyrights and other intellectual property rights, or otherwise violates the law.

12 It is envisaged that updated versions of AKASHA will contain self moderation functionalities enabling the AKASHA community to keep AKASHA clean from any unlawful content and activities without any direct intervention from AKASHA International GmbH.
app.terms.registrationBody: 13 You may create an Identity using the credentials of your choice or maintain multiple Identities. However, as AKASHA runs on the Ethereum Platform, the use of AKASHA involves certain payments. Accordingly, you will not use AKASHA if you are under 13 years old.
app.terms.gasDeductionBody: 14 When creating an Identity on AKASHA, you will be provided with an Ethereum Address (Ethereum Identity Key) to which you will need to make a transfer of a small amount of Ether (ETH). The Ethereum Identity Key contains a pre-set functionality to deduct from your Identity Key Balance an AKASHA Gas Deduction, which is triggered by every transaction you make on AKASHA. The amount of ETH on your Ethereum Identity Key Balance remains always in your sole control and may be withdrawn any time. AKASHA and/or AKASHA International GmbH has no access to your Ethereum Identity Key.
app.terms.noWarrantyBody: 15 You understand and expressly accept that there is no warranty whatsoever regarding the availability, functionality, and/or the success of AKASHA and the Ethereum Identity Key , expressed or implied, to the extent permitted by law, and that the Pre-Alpha release of AKASHA is used at the sole risk of yourself on an “as is” and “under development” basis and without, to the extent permitted by law, any warranties of any kind, including, but not limited to, warranties of title or implied warranties, merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose;
app.terms.passwordBody:
16 As part of creating your identity, you will need to provide a password. The password will be used to access AKASHA and make use of your Ethereum Identity Key Balance. You must keep this password safe and may not share it with anybody.

17 When logging in you have an option to create a secure “authentication hash/token” for a amount of time in your choice, which allows you to securely sign transactions while logged in without having to reintroduce your password each time you post, comment or vote on something (Open Login Function). When the selected time period expires, you will be prompted to reintroduce your password. Please assure that you do not leave your AKASHA access device unattended after having chosen the Open Login Function.
app.terms.risksBody:
18 You understand and accept the risks in connection with using AKASHA and transferring ETH to the Deposit Wallet as exemplary set forth hereinafter. In particular, but not concluding, you understand the inherent risks listed hereinafter:

  • Risk of software weaknesses: You understand and accept that AKASHA, the smart contract system concept, the underlying software application and software platform (i.e. the Ethereum blockchain) is still in an early development stage and unproven, why there is no warranty that AKASHA will run uninterrupted or error-free and why there is an inherent risk that the software could contain weaknesses, vulnerabilities or bugs causing, inter alia, the complete loss of your profile and/or ETH submitted by you to the Deposit Wallet.
  • Regulatory risk: The User understands and accepts that the blockchain technology allows new forms of interaction and that it is possible that certain jurisdictions will apply existing regulations on, or introduce new regulations addressing, blockchain technology based applications, which may be contrary to the current setup of AKASHA and which may, inter alia, result in substantial modifications of the AKASHA, including its termination and the loss of ETH submitted by you to the Deposit Wallet.
  • Risk of abandonment / lack of success: You understand and accept that the development of AKASHA beyond the Beta Version may be abandoned for a number of reasons, including lack of interest from the public, lack of funding, lack of commercial success or prospects (e.g. caused by competing projects).
  • Risk of theft: You understand and accept that the AKASHA smart contract concept, the underlying software application and software platform (i.e. the Ethereum blockchain) may be exposed to attacks by hackers or other individuals that that could result in theft or loss of ETH submitted by you to the Deposit Wallet.
  • Risk of Ethereum mining attacks: You understand and accept that, as with other cryptocurrencies, the blockchain used for AKASHA is susceptible to mining attacks, including but not limited to double-spend attacks, majority mining power attacks, “selfish-mining” attacks, and race condition attacks.
  • Risk of new version: You understand and accept that the network of miners will be ultimately in control of AKASHA. You understand that a majority of these miners could agree at any point to make changes to the official AKASHA network and to run the new version of the smart contract system.
app.terms.taxationBody: 19 You bear the sole responsibility to determine if any action or transaction related to AKASHA have tax implications for yourself.
app.terms.noLiabilityBody:
20 You acknowledge and agree that, to the fullest extent permitted by any applicable law, the User will not hold any developers, contractors or founders of AKASHA and/or AKASHA International GmbH liable for any and all damages or injury whatsoever caused by or related to the use of, or the inability to use, AKASHA under any cause or action whatsoever of any kind in any jurisdiction, including, without limitation, actions for breach of warranty, breach of contract or tort (including negligence) and that developers of AKASHA and/or AKASHA International GmbH shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, exemplary or consequential damages (including for loss of profits, goodwill, data goodwill or other intangible losses) in any way whatsoever arising out of the use of, or the inability to use of AKASHA.

21 In particular, you acknowledge and agree that AKASHA and any of its developers, contractors or founders and/or AKASHA International GmbH will not be liable under any circumstances to you or any other party, person or entity for any damages or losses that may result from the following:

  • Termination, suspension, loss or modification of AKASHA;
  • Use of or inability to use AKASHA;
  • Access delays or acces interruptions to AKASHA;
  • Data non-delivery, mis-delivery, corruption, destruction or other modification;
  • Events beyond AKASHA’s control;
  • Application of any applicable law, regulation or AKASHA policy;
  • Disbursement or non-disbursement of fund held on your Deposit Wallet;
  • Loss or liability resulting from errors, omissions or misstatements related to AKASHA (this includes loss of data resulting from delays, nondeliveries, mis-deliveries or service interruptions independent of the cause);
  • Loss or liability resulting from the unauthorized use or misuse of your Identity, password or other security authentication option;
  • Unauthorized use or alteration of your content;
  • Violation of any third party rights, including, but not limited to, rights of publicity, rights of privacy, intellectual property rights and any other proprietary rights;
  • Any other matter relating to your use of AKASHA.

22 AKASHA and/or AKASHA International GmbH disclaims any responsibility for any content, goods and services sold by you or otherwise made available through AKASHA, or the quality or accuracy of any information on AKASHA. AKASHA and/or AKASHA International GmbH will not endorse, warrant, or guarantee any product or service offered through AKASHA, and will not be a party to or in any way monitor any transaction between you and third-party offered through or resulting from the services or use of AKASHA, including, but not limited to, all licensing of content, transactions, or any business agreements.

23 You agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless AKASHA and/or AKASHA International GmbH from and against any and all claims, losses, expenses brought by a third party that arises out of your breach of your obligations, warranties or representations under these Terms.
app.terms.miscBody:
24 You agree that if any portion of these Terms is found illegal or unenforceable, in whole or in part, such provision shall, as to such jurisdiction, be ineffective solely to the extent of such determination of invalidity or unenforceability without affecting the validity or enforceability thereof in any other manner or jurisdiction and without affecting the remaining provisions of the Terms, which shall continue to be in full force and effect.

25 The applicable law is Swiss law. Any dispute arising out of or in connection with AKASHA shall be finally settled by the ordinary courts of Zug, Switzerland.
app.akasha.terms.title: AKASHA: Terms of Service
app.akasha.terms.preface:
1 AKASHA is a next-generation social blogging network powered by a new kind of computer known as Ethereum and the Inter Planetary File System.
            2 By using AKASHA and creating an AKASHA Identity or a Profile Smart Contract, you confirm to have carefully reviewed and to fully understand and agree to the terms and conditions set forth in this document (the “Terms”).
            3 Because the current version of AKASHA is a Pre-Alpha-Release only, we may ask you to review and accept new or supplemental terms that apply to your interaction with AKASHA and newly introduced functionalities in the future.
            4 Prior to installing AKAHSA, please ensure that you have downloaded the .zip file by using the pre-alpha invites directly sent out by AKASHA. Unpacking / installing any other files may involve substantial security risks.
app.akasha.terms.privacyBody: 5 Your privacy is very important to us which distinguishes AKASHA from any known Social Media Network. We designed AKASHA in a way that you remain in control of how you share your data with others. AKASHA will not collect and use your content and information for any other purposes than chosen by you.
app.akasha.terms.sharingYourContentBody:
6 You own all of the content and information you post on AKASHA. AKASHA allows you to control your content and how it is shared through your AKASHA settings.
            7 For content that is covered by intellectual property rights, like photos, text and videos (IP Content), you have the possibility to choose between different Licence Options (covering a spectrum from all rights reserved to no rights reserved) allowing you the specify how and under what conditions your content may be used by others.
            8 By publishing your IP Content on AKASHA, you grant AKASHA non-exclusive, transferable, sub-licensable, royalty-free, worldwide license to use the IP content for the purpose of its publication on AKASHA and subject to the conditions specified by you in the Licence Options.
            9 You are aware that AKASHA is a decentralized application and that, consequently, content published on AKASHA is not under control of any legal entity or private individual. Accordingly, you may not fully delete any content published from the AKASHA Platform. When you remove content, your content is only delisted and harder to find for others. However, you understand that removed content persist without any time limitation and may still be available to others.
            10 When you publish content using the setting “No rights reserved” in the License Option, it means that you are allowing everyone to access and use that content, to associate it with you (i.e., your name and profile picture) and that you wave all your copyrights and related rights to this content.
app.akasha.terms.noUnlawfulBody:
11 You are aware that AKASHA is a fully decentralized platform that is not under control of any legal entity or private individual. AKASHA has no knowledge of and no means to control whether any content published on AKASHA violates any third party intellectual property rights or is illegal under the laws of certain jurisdictions. Accordingly, the success of AKASHA relies in the responsibility of each User. By using AKASHA you commit to keep AKASHA clean from any unlawful content and activities. In particular:
                §  You will not solicit login information or access a Profile belonging to someone else.
                §  You will not bully, intimidate or harass any other User.
                §  You will not post content that is hate speech, threatening, incites violence
                §  You will not use AKASHA to do anything unlawful in your jurisdiction or in Switzerland
                §  You will not use AKASHA to do anything misleading, malicious or discriminatory.
                §  You will not post content or take any action on AKASHA that infringes or violates someone else's rights or otherwise violates the law.
            12 It is envisaged that updated versions of AKASHA will contain functionalities which enable the AKASHA Community to self moderate the content published on the platform without direct involvement from AKASHA International GmbH.
app.akasha.terms.registrationBody: 13 AKASHA is all about privacy. You may create an Identity using the credentials of your choice or maintain multiple Identities. However, as AKASHA runs on the Ethereum Platform, the use of AKASHA involves certain payments. Accordingly, you will not use AKASHA if you are under 13 years old.
app.akasha.terms.paymentOfFeesBody: 14 When creating an Identity, you will be provided with an Ethereum Address (Ethereum Identity Key) to which you will need to make a transfer of a small amount of Ether (ETH). Whenever your usage of AKASHA is subject to the payment of a fee, this fee – after you have provided your consent in each individual case – will be withdrawn from your Ethereum Identity Key Balance. The amount of ETH on your Ethereum Identity Key Balance remains in your control and may be withdrawn any time.
app.akasha.terms.advertisementBody: 15 AKASHA shall remain free from any advertising and other commercial or sponsored content. In order to help us do that, you agree to refrain from using AKASHA for advertising purposes.
app.akasha.terms.noWarrantyBody: 16 You understand and expressly accept that there is no warranty whatsoever regarding the availability, functionality, and/or the success of AKASHA and the Ethereum Identity Key , expressed or implied, to the extent permitted by law, and that the Pre-Alpha release of AKASHA is used at the sole risk of yourself on an “as is” and “under development” basis and without, to the extent permitted by law, any warranties of any kind, including, but not limited to, warranties of title or implied warranties, merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose;

17    As part of creating your identity, you will need to provide a password. The password will be used to access AKASHA and make use of your Ethereum Identity Key Balance. You must keep this password safe and may not share it with anybody.
            18    When logging in you have an option to create a secure “authentication hash/token” for a amount of time in your choice, which allows you to securely sign transactions while logged in without having to reintroduce your password each time you post, comment or vote on something (Open Login Function). When the selected time period expires, you will be prompted to reintroduce your password. Please assure that you do not leave your AKASHA access device unattended after having chosen the Open Login Function.z

19 You understand and accept the risks in connection with using AKASHA and transferring ETH to the Deposit Wallet as exemplary set forth hereinafter. In particular, but not concluding, you understand the inherent risks listed hereinafter:
                §  Risk of software weaknesses: You understand and accept that AKASHA, the smart contract system concept, the underlying software application and software platform (i.e. the Ethereum blockchain) is still in an early development stage and unproven, why there is no warranty that AKASHA will run uninterrupted or error-free and why there is an inherent risk that the software could contain weaknesses, vulnerabilities or bugs causing, inter alia, the complete loss of your profile and/or ETH submitted by you to the Deposit Wallet.
                §  Regulatory risk: The User understands and accepts that the blockchain technology allows new forms of interaction and that it is possible that certain jurisdictions will apply existing regulations on, or introduce new regulations addressing, blockchain technology based applications, which may be contrary to the current setup of AKASHA and which may, inter alia, result in substantial modifications of the AKASHA, including its termination and the loss of ETH submitted by you to the Deposit Wallet.
                §  Risk of abandonment / lack of success: You understand and accept that the development of AKASHA beyond the Beta Version may be abandoned for a number of reasons, including lack of interest from the public, lack of funding, lack of commercial success or prospects (e.g. caused by competing projects).
                §  Risk of theft: You understand and accept that the AKASHA smart contract concept, the underlying software application and software platform (i.e. the Ethereum blockchain) may be exposed to attacks by hackers or other individuals that that could result in theft or loss of ETH submitted by you to the Deposit Wallet.
                §  Risk of Ethereum mining attacks: You understand and accept that, as with other cryptocurrencies, the blockchain used for AKASHA is susceptible to mining attacks, including but not limited to double-spend attacks, majority mining power attacks, “selfish-mining” attacks, and race condition attacks.
                §  Risk of new version: You understand and accept that the network of miners will be ultimately in control of AKASHA. You understand that a majority of these miners could agree at any point to make changes to the official AKASHA network and to run the new version of the smart contract system.

app.akasha.terms.miscBody:
24 You agree that if any portion of these Terms is found illegal or unenforceable, in whole or in part, such provision shall, as to such jurisdiction, be ineffective solely to the extent of such determination of invalidity or unenforceability without affecting the validity      or enforceability thereof in any other manner or jurisdiction and without affecting the remaining provisions of the Terms, which shall continue to be in full force and effect.
            25 The applicable law is Swiss law. Any dispute arising out of or in connection with AKASHA
            shall be finally settled by the ordinary courts of the registered domicile of the defendant.
app.chat.inputPlaceholder: Write something nice and press "Enter" to send it
app.chat.emptyChannelInputError: Channel name should not be empty
app.chat.startWithAlphanumericError: Channel name must begin with lowercase alphanumeric character
app.chat.illegalCharactersFormat: Only lowercase alphanumeric characters, dashes (-) and underscores (_) allowed
app.chat.channelTooLongError: Channel name must not have more than 32 characters
app.chat.channelDisclaimer: This channel is ephemeral, messages will disappear in 24h since publishing
app.confirm.gasInputLabel: Maximum amount of gas to use
app.confirm.gasInputDisclaimer: Gas to be used by this transaction. Unused gas will be returned.
app.confirm.inactiveEntryError: The voting period for this entry has ended
app.confirm.publishTag: Are you sure you want to publish tag "{tagName}"?
app.confirm.subscribeTag: Are you sure you want to subscribe to tag "{tagName}"?
app.confirm.unsubscribeTag: Are you sure you want to unsubscribe from tag "{tagName}"?
app.confirm.followProfile: Are you sure you want to follow "@{akashaId}"?
app.confirm.unfollowProfile: Are you sure you want to unfollow "@{akashaId}"?
app.confirm.updateProfile: Are you sure you want to update your profile?
app.confirm.publishEntry: Are you sure you want to publish "{title}"?
app.confirm.publishNewEntryVersion: Are you sure you want to update "{title}"?
app.confirm.upvoteWeightDisclaimer: @{publisherAkashaId} will receive {eth} AETH from your +{voteWeight} vote
app.confirm.downvoteWeightDisclaimer: {eth} AETH will go to the faucet from your {voteWeight} vote
app.confirm.voteWeightDisclaimer: Bigger weight means bigger impact, but also more costs for you.
app.confirm.feeAgreement:
By proceeding to vote this entry, you agree with the {fee} AETH fee,
                meaning a total of {total} AETH excluding gas cost
                which will be deducted from your {balance} AETH balance.
app.confirm.publishComment: Are you sure you want to comment?
app.confirm.claim:
Are you sure you want to claim this entry's balance?
                {entryTitle}
app.confirm.sendTip: Are you sure you want to blabla?
app.entry.publishedBlockDiff: Published {blockDiff, number} {blockDiff, plural, one {block} few {blocks} many {blocks} other {blocks}} ago
app.entry.wordsCount: {words, number} {words, plural, one {word} few {words} many {words} other {words}}
app.entry.unresolvedEntry: There are no peers online right now.
app.entry.newComments: {count, number} new {count, plural, one {comment} few {comments} many {comments} other {comments}}
app.entry.olderVersion: You are now viewing an older

app.error.generalSettings: An error occurred while getting your general settings
app.error.gethGetOptions: An error occurred while getting geth service options
app.error.gethGetStatus: An error occurred while getting geth service status
app.error.gethGetSyncStatus: An error occurred while getting synchronization status

app.error.gethSettings: An error occurred while getting your geth settings

app.error.gethStop: Geth service could not be stopped

app.error.ipfsGetPorts: An error occurred while getting ipfs service ports

app.error.ipfsStop: IPFS service could not be stopped
app.error.saveGeneralSettings: An error occurred while saving your settings
app.form.confirmPassphraseToContinue: You need to confirm your passphrase to continue
app.inputField.title: Title
app.inputField.name: Name
app.form.gasAmountError: Gas amount must be between {min} and {max}
app.form.voteWeightError: Vote weight must be between {minWeight} and {maxWeight}
app.form.notEnoughFunds: You don't have enough funds in your balance
app.form.alphanumericError: Tags can contain only letters, numbers, and one dash ( - ) or underscore ( _ ) between characters.
app.form.tooShortError: Tags should have at least 4 characters.
app.form.tipAmountError: The amount should be at least {minAmount} AETH
app.form.tipDecimalsError: The amount should not have more than {maxDecimals} decimals
app.general.termsOfService: Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
app.createProfile.serviceStoppedWarning: Geth and IPFS must be started
app.notification.saveGethSettingsSuccess:
You have successfully saved your settings. You need to restart your geth
                        service for your changes to be applied.
app.notification.saveIpfsSettingsSuccess:
You have successfully saved your settings. You need to restart your IPFS
                        service for your changes to be applied.
app.notification.setIpfsPortsSuccess:
You have successfully set the IPFS ports. You need to restart your IPFS
                        service for your changes to be applied.
app.profile.terms:
By proceeding to create your account and use AKASHA, you are agreeing to
                         our {termsLink}. If you do not agree, you cannot use
                         AKASHA.
app.profile.yourIdentityIsBroadcasted: Your identity is broadcasted into the AKASHA private network.
app.profile.willTakeFewMinutes: This will take a few moments
app.profile.weCannotHelpRecover: Since we cannot help you recover passphrases, or identities make sure to:
app.profile.writePassKeepSafe: Write down your passphrase and keep it safe
app.profile.backupYourId: Backup your ID now and don’t be sorry later
app.profile.dontShareKey: Don’t (ever) share your key with other people
app.search.serviceError: Search service is not available at the moment. Please try again later.
app.search.queryLengthError: The query must have maximum 32 characters
app.search.tryToReconnect: You may have been disconnected from the search service. Try to reconnect.
app.setup.changeGethDataDir: Change this if geth has different data directory
app.setup.changeGethAlreadyStarted: Change this if geth is already started with --ipcpath
app.setup.changeIfIpfsRunning: Change this if ipfs daemon is already running
app.setup.gethCacheSizeError: Cache size should not be less than 512Mb
app.setup.akashaNextGenNetwork:
AKASHA is a next-generation social blogging network powered by a new
                        kind of world computer known as Ethereum and the
                        Inter Planetary File System.
app.setup.youHavenNotHeared:
If you haven’t heard of these technologies before don’t worry, simply
                        click next and we’ll take care of the rest.
app.setup.ifYouHaveEth:
If you already have the Ethereum Go client or IPFS installed on your
                        machine please choose the advanced option.
app.setup.beforeSyncStart:
We are starting synchronization with the Ethereum world computer.
                        Please be patient.
app.setup.onSyncStart:
Your machine is currently synchronizing with the Ethereum world computer
                        network. You will be able to log in and enjoy the full AKASHA experience as
                        soon as the sync is complete.
app.setup.afterSyncFinish:
Synchronization is complete. IPFS service needs to be started in order to
                        continue. You can start it manually from the status bar in the header or
                        click NEXT to start it automatically.
app.setup.noProfilesFound: No profiles found. Create a new identity or import an existing one.
app.setup.peerCount: {peerCount, number} {peerCount, plural, one {peer} few {peers} many {peers} other {peers}}, {peerCount, plural, one {connected} other {connected}}
app.setup.gethStopped:
Geth service is not working. Please start it manually in order to fetch
                        your profiles.
app.setup.ipfsStopped:
IPFS service is stopped. Please start it manually in order to fetch
                        your profiles.
app.tutorial.akashaContent:
With AKASHA your thoughts and ideas will echo throughout humanity's existence,
                thanks to a planetary-scale network immune to censorship by design. The information
                lives and spreads across the network without relying on a particular entity,
                not even us.
app.tutorial.ethereumContent:
Ethereum allowed us to build a new kind of application that removes the need
                to blindly trust server administrators. Thanks to its transparent properties we
                have strong authentication, identity, verifiability, voting and
                micro-transactions.
app.tutorial.ipfsTitle: Enhanced By The Inter-Planetary File System
app.tutorial.ipfsContent:
Thanks to the Inter-Planetary File System (IPFS) we removed also the need
                for servers to distribute and store your content. This allows users to circumvent
                traditional censorship blockades and empowers people with real freedom of
                expression.
app.tutorial.webTitle: Towards A Better Web In Service Of Humanity
app.tutorial.webContent:
The future isn't some place where we are going to go but a place we get to
                create. We deserve a better web and we now have the tools to make it happen.
                Together we can create a world where freedom of expression on the web is a right,
                not a feature.
app.validator.min: :attribute must be at least :min characters long.
app.validator.max: :attribute must not have more than :max characters.
app.validator.invalidCharacters: :attribute must start with a letter and only contain valid characters
app.validator.passphraseNotMatching: Oups! Passphrase verification is different than first one!
app.validator.akashaIdNotValid: Only lowercase alphanumeric characters, dots and underscores allowed
app.profile.entriesCount: {entriesCount, number} {entriesCount, plural, one {entry} few {entries} many {entries} other {entries}}
